intro: Cirsium heterophylloides, commonly known as the heterophyllous thistle, is a flowering plant species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive leaves, which vary in shape depending on their position on the plant—typically basal leaves are more lobed, while upper leaves are narrower and more linear. The plant produces purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It grows in a variety of habitats, including grasslands, woodland edges, and disturbed soils. Cirsium heterophylloides is often found in moist environments and can form dense colonies in suitable conditions.
